job_title: Customer Resolutions Advisor in Chelmsford, England
pros:
I have nothing but praise for CHP from start to finish there were no delays everything done promptly and really efficiently.
Training is great and everyone is really lovely have never felt so welcome even predominantly working from home everyone i interact with is friendly and helpful
cons: not being able to come into the office due to covid

pros: Some colleagues are caring and supportive, however those are usually forced to leave
cons: Once a charity, this company is solely profit-driven machine now, focused only on their business needs. They use people as much as possible and then get rid of them. No career progression and no real support. A lot of nice and promising words about their values and culture on paper, however reality is the opposite. No diversity and equality, those from minority backgrounds will always be alienated, as well as some of their departments have less privileges. Constant restructures make staff anxious and worried about their positions; any new comers are considered as threat and everything is done to drive them away. Staff turnover is high, which shows how the things are.

review_title: Smooth start in a pandemic from a supportive employer
pros: Grounded, community focused organisation with a strong connection to place
cons: Not clear how to progress career advancement opportunities for new staff

pros:
Supportive working environment
Ongoing training and professional development
Helpful staff and managers
Leadership open-minded when employees have ideas to improve the business
cons: Takes time to secure promotions but relevant training is provided.

job_title: External Communications in Great Dunmow, England
pros: Inclusive, good benefits, understanding, good communication
cons: Working from home, struggle to build rapport with my team and other employees

pros: Throughout the pandemic everyone has been kept in work in full pay with an annual increase even if only able to work 50%. People who couldn’t do the day job because of the restrictions were found other activity where possible and still paid in full. Very flexible working too e.g. for people with caring responsibilities while working from home.

review_title: All the gear and no idea.
pros: Parking, Nice building with clean facilities. A free piece of fruit twice a week and tea / coffee.
cons:
They have all the processes on paper but don't actually implement them. Policies and Procedures are just a tick in the box exercise. Unfortunately theirs a definite bullying culture where people go out of their way to obstruct you from doing your work which certainly demoralises staff who then leave. Long term staff who have built their little empires to the detriment of anyone else. Management who don't want to listen to new ideas or improve moving forward. A lot of money is being spent on team away days and corporate functions but will be a waste of money as it's the culture that is the issue.
Building is ridiculously hot and air con doesn't really work. If you like a hot work place then its right for you.

pros: There are none this is a criminally manager organisation
cons: If you complain of harassment at work in good faith they will report you to the police who will try to criminally frame you, you will get assaulted, death threats and forced out of your job

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Chelmsford, England
pros: Extremely nice colleagues, very easy to park
Friendly place, clear vision, great opportunities, good benefits, modern office with excellent facilities.
